avalancheActivity.comment: Avalanches can be treiggered even by one sole skier and grow to large size. Remote triggerings are possible, esp. on shady wind-protected slopes where there has been heavy snowfall. Particularly treacherous are the foot of rock walls. Whumphf noises can indicate imminent danger. Due to solar radiation, increasingly frequent small loose-snow avalanches can be expected. In addition, isolated mostly small glide-snow avalanches are possible in the major areas of precipitation.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Main danger: weak layers in old snowpack

snowpackStructure.comment: Since Tuesday above 1800m, there has been 40-60cm of fresh snow, locally more. The strong-velocity winds have transported the fresh snow, wind-protected zones above 2400m: in the lower part of the snowpack are faceted expansively metamorphosed weak layer. Shady slopes where the snow is shallos above 1800m: fresh snow and drifts blanket a weak old snowpack. Shady slopes below 1800m: the fresh snow lies deposited atop a thoroughly wet old snowpack.

weatherForecast.comment: On Thursday, weak high-pressure impact will bring very sunny weather. Visibility will be very good. A few clouds will move into the western massifs at the end of the day. Only light winds from southerly directions. At 2000m: -1 degree; at 3000m: -5 degrees. Source: GeoSphere Austria

avalancheActivity.comment: Avalanches can be triggered by one sole skier in some pladces and, in isolated cases, grow to large size, particularly on shady wind-protected slopes in zones where snowfall has been heavy. Due to solar radiation, increasingly frequent mostly small-siozed loose-snow avalanches can be expected.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Caution: weak layers in old snowpack

snowpackStructure.comment: Since Tuesday above 1800m, there has been 30-40cm of fresh snow, locally more. The strong-velocity winds have transported the fresh snow, wind-protected zones above 2400m: in the lower part of the snowpack are faceted expansively metamorphosed weak layer. Shady slopes where the snow is shallos above 1800m: fresh snow and drifts blanket a weak old snowpack. Shady slopes below 1800m: the fresh snow lies deposited atop a thoroughly wet old snowpack.

tendency.highlights: No significant change in avalanche danger levels anticipated

weatherForecast.comment: On Thursday, weak high-pressure impact will bring very sunny weather. Visibility will be very good. A few clouds will move into the western massifs at the end of the day. Only light winds from southerly directions. At 2000m: -1 degree. Source: GeoSphere Austria

avalancheActivity.highlights: Very little snow on the ground

snowpackStructure.comment: Rainfall led to the snowpack becoming massively wet in all aspected over widespread areas. There is little snow on the ground.

tendency.highlights: No significant change in avalanche danger levels expected

weatherForecast.comment: On Thursday, weak high-pressure impact will bring very sunny weather. Visibility will be very good. A few clouds will move into the western massifs at the end of the day. Only light winds from southerly directions. At 2000m: -1 degree. Source: GeoSphere Austria

avalancheActivity.comment: Due to fresh snow and SW winds, small snowdrift accumulations have been generated in gullies and bowls. Isolated danger zones occuron NW/N/NE facing slopes above 1800m.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Isolated danger zones occur on NW/N/NE facing slopes above 1800m

snowpackStructure.comment: Fresh snow and snowdrifts lie atop a thoroughly wet old snowpack. Below 1600m, hardly any snow on the ground.

tendency.highlights: No significant change in avalanche danger levels anticipated

weatherForecast.comment: On Thursday, weak high-pressure impact will bring very sunny weather. Visibility will be very good. A few clouds will move into the western massifs at the end of the day. Only light winds from southerly directions. At 2000m: -1 degree. Source: GeoSphere Austria

customData.generalHeadline: Main danger: weak layers in old snowpack
